column1: Táriba is a town in Táchira
column3: and is the capital of the Cárdenas Municipality. It was founded in 1602. Táriba has a population of 128
column4: 590. It's located on the outsides of the city of San Cristóbal. Like other Venezuelan cities
column5: Táriba was founded by an ancient indigenous people and then discovered by Alonso Pérez de Tolosa in 1547.

column1: Tariba has a very catholic culture
column2: this can be shown in the Basílica de Nuestra Señora de la Consolación
column3: like many other cities in Venezuela it has its own plaza bolivar.
